results.title: Timber
results.brief_description: A survey of the forests from which Australia obtains timber supplies for firewood, building and other industrial purposes. Illustrates tree-felling and the various methods used to transport logs to timber-mills. Overviews the preservation of natural forests and revegetation programs.

results.title: All that is solid
results.brief_description: This is a speculative documentary on the subject of the future of Australia. It is conceived as a series of competing discourses with visionaries, politicians, media commentators and others, who are variously optimistic and pessimistic. Interviews are interspersed with symbolic, imaginative drama.

results.title: Two Girls and a Baby
results.creator_credit: Kelli Simpson, Penny Robins and Annamax Media
results.brief_description:
An entertaining look at the IVF process from the point of view of a lesbian couple as they deal with sperm banks, relationships, baby clothes, and community resistance.

Starring Claudia Karvan and Niky Wendt.

results.title: Women in the surf
results.brief_description: The first non-fiction feature about Australia’s women of the surf tells the history of women’s surfing in Australia from 1915. It moves through the big board era to the present day, with women becoming a surfing entity in their own right. The video shows the women surf riders surfing their own calender and tells of their hopes, fears and pleasures as they ride the waves.

results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movies: Reel 4]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

This film shows various visitations to South Western Victoria stretching from Cape Otway to Geelong.

The film begins in Apollo Bay and continues with visits to the Barham River, Cape Otway, Mariner’s lookout and lighthouse, Geelong, Carisbrook Falls and Great Ocean Road with the Twelve Apostles.

The film includes many scenic views of the sea, beaches, mountains and forests. There are several scenes with groups cooking food outdoors and eating throughout.

Of interest is the fashion of the time including men and women’s bathers (swimwear) and the wooden body boards and kayaks used.

Also seen is the T&I mutual Life Society clock tower in Geelong with the famous Father and Son figurine bell ringers coming out to ring the bell.

The film finishes with a scene showing the result of rough seas with capsized boats and debris.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:05:00 Apollo Bay shopping strip with old vintage cars
00:01:55:00 horseman, cattle and dogs on the hills
00:03:48:00 Cape Otway Lighthouse and sea views
00:06:59:00 group playing beach cricket
00:08:23:00 Eastern Beach in Geelong followed by Geelong street scenes
00:09:56:00 Johnstone Park next to Geelong Library and Arts Centre
00:10:56:00 Joclyn Penington and older sister with old wooden kayak on the beach
00:11:01:00 Dr Penington in vintage swimming trunks carrying kayak on his shoulder
00:11:19:00 Penington girls in vintage bathers with friend sunbathing and playing around at Eastern Beach, Geelong
0:12:18:00 St Mary’s Church, Geelong
00:13:12:00 Geelong City Hall and former Geelong Post Office and Johnstone Park Pavilion
00:14:01:00 T&G Mutual Life Society clock tower building with close up of the father and son figures coming out of the tower to ring the bell
00:14:31:00 body boarding in Geelong on wooden boards
00:15:24:00 fantail on a barb wired fence
00:19:37:00 group getting their photo taken
00:22:26:00 rough seas with capsized boats and debris at the port

results.title: [Raymond Penington Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
The Raymond Penington Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm colour and black-and-white films made between 1938 and 1965. Dr. Raymond Penington (born 1903) was a medical doctor from Melbourne, Victoria. He and his wife Edith lived in Papua New Guinea in the late 1920s before returning to Melbourne in 1931 and settling in Canterbury. They had three children, Margaret, Vivienne and Jocelyn. His home movies focus on family life in Melbourne and holidays in regional Victoria.

This film shows the Penington family visiting several animal sanctuaries in Victoria, Australia. The film is a good example of animal captivity and fashions of the 1940s.

The film begins at Melbourne Zoo with the zoo entrance (built in 1939). The famous elephant Queenie who gave rides for over 40 years is shown. This would have been shortly before she killed her trainer by accident in 1943 leading to her being put down.

There are a number of scenes with the three Penington girls, Margaret, Viviene and Jocelyn, feeding animals. Scenes of monkeys and wallabies amongst other animals are also shown.

The film then moves to Balwyn Wildlife sanctuary with scenes of a monkey circus, pony and dog show. A baboon in clothes doing tricks appears to be the main attraction.

The film then moves to Badger Creek Sanctuary (later called Healesville sanctuary) where platypuses, emus, eagles and koalas are seen.

The film finishes with seals playing in their enclosure.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:04:00 Melbourne Zoo Entrance
00:00:17:00 Mrs Penington, Margaret, Viviene and Jocelyn walking along garden path at the zoo. Mrs Penington is pushing an old fashioned stroller.
00:00:25:00 Penington girls feeding a number of different animals, riding Queenie the elephant and on the Merry-go-round
00:04:59:00 animals being directed to perform tricks by man with a stick including monkeys, dogs and monkeys riding ponies
00:06:08:00 TITLE: “Wild Life – Balwyn.” followed by numerous animals of the Sanctuary
00:07:12:00 monkey circus
00:08:21:00 baboon in clothes rocking in a rocking chair and rides a bike
00:09:17:00 lyrebird foraging in the forest with sparrows, Badger Creek Sanctuary
00:10:18:00 koala with baby eating in a eucalyptus tree
00:10:54:00 platypuses being hand fed in enclosure
00:12:12:00 seals in enclosure playing

results.title: [Phillip Annett Home Movie]
results.brief_description:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

Selected highlights list (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:03:00 Close-up of men’s faces as they walk past the camera, waving their hats and gesturing. Great snapshot of the period and fashion.
00:00:07:00 Men walking towards camera showing great examples of 1940s fashion, streetscape and vintage cars
00:00:33:00 People in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup and The Sun advertising in the background
00:00:45:00 Two men in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup advertising in the background
00:00:46:00 Man in the street with vintage Myer delivery truck in background
00:00:47:00 Men with baby in vintage pram showing excellent examples of men’s fashion
00:00:56:00 Two men in RAAF Uniforms walk towards and past the camera
00:01:08:00 Man walks towards camera and waves with vintage cars beside him in the street
00:01:14:00 Two school boys holding hands walk down the street towards the camera
00:01:19:00 Young man riding towards camera on his bicycle, he waves. Good example of streetscape.
00:01:21:00 Man in the street smoking a pipe with vintage cars in the background
00:01:24:00 Small boy points and shoots a toy gun showing good example of children’s fashion
00:01:25:00 Two children run down the footpath. Good children’s fashion and street view.
00:01:28:00 Boy and girl stand on footpath and blow kisses
00:01:32:00 Sequence of images showing various individuals standing outside their houses. Good example of houses and street.
00:01:34:00 Old man wearing trousers and braces walking down the footpath
00:01:43:00 Exterior images of period houses
00:01:55:00 View of Government House from the interior of a car as they drive under a bridge
00:02:00:00 Lindberg and Foster signage
00:02:04:00 Sequence of images of women walking, towards and past the camera waving. Good fashion reference.
00:02:11:00 Woman with pram and baby walking down the street
00:02:13:00 Women walking down the street showing great fashion examples
00:02:49:00 Show pony/horse in backyard with show ribbons adorning its back. Impressed onlookers observe the prize winner of the 1949 Coast National Exhibition.
00:03:33:00 A man and a woman walk down a country road, a vintage car drives past in the background
00:03:43:00 Diggers Rest Post Office and General Store
00:03:45:00 People standing in rural setting country Victoria
00:04:36:00 Royal Melbourne Show fire truck display in main arena including Northwood Park fire truck with woodchopping in background
00:05:12:00 Royal Melbourne Show horse riding and woodchopping display
00:05:28:00 Harness racing display at Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:37:00 Horse riding and horse flag and barrel event Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:49:00 Girl on dapple grey horse riding in front of stables at the Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:59:00 Inner Melbourne street scenes, possibly Parkville
00:06:26:00 McInerney’s Hotel Max, Victoria Bitter, Orlando Wines signage on exterior brick wall. Great vintage car and period houses in front of sign.
00:06:29:00 Children in birthday party fashion attire
00:07:04:00 Children in party fashion outfits in suburban backyard with Hills Hoist, mums join in the fun
00:07:28:00 Men and women display great hair fashion of the day as they walk towards camera
00:07:37:00 Children at the birthday party stand under the Hills Hoist and watch a man riding a child’s three-wheel bike
00:07:41:00 Older man leads the birthday party children under the Hills Hoist. Good fashion reference for children.
00:07:55:00 Black and white horse and cart in front of Mynor Fruit Cup advertising. Man in bowler hat and braces runs back and forth and kicks his legs in the air. Great old footage from the time.
00:08:05:00 Women standing in front of sign for the Narbethong Blacks Spur Hotel
00:08:19:00 Man in uniform walks along the street outside pub/hotel
00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.

00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.
description_for_label:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

Selected highlights list (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:03:00 Close-up of men’s faces as they walk past the camera, waving their hats and gesturing. Great snapshot of the period and fashion.
00:00:07:00 Men walking towards camera showing great examples of 1940s fashion, streetscape and vintage cars
00:00:33:00 People in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup and The Sun advertising in the background
00:00:45:00 Two men in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup advertising in the background
00:00:46:00 Man in the street with vintage Myer delivery truck in background
00:00:47:00 Men with baby in vintage pram showing excellent examples of men’s fashion
00:00:56:00 Two men in RAAF Uniforms walk towards and past the camera
00:01:08:00 Man walks towards camera and waves with vintage cars beside him in the street
00:01:14:00 Two school boys holding hands walk down the street towards the camera
00:01:19:00 Young man riding towards camera on his bicycle, he waves. Good example of streetscape.
00:01:21:00 Man in the street smoking a pipe with vintage cars in the background
00:01:24:00 Small boy points and shoots a toy gun showing good example of children’s fashion
00:01:25:00 Two children run down the footpath. Good children’s fashion and street view.
00:01:28:00 Boy and girl stand on footpath and blow kisses
00:01:32:00 Sequence of images showing various individuals standing outside their houses. Good example of houses and street.
00:01:34:00 Old man wearing trousers and braces walking down the footpath
00:01:43:00 Exterior images of period houses
00:01:55:00 View of Government House from the interior of a car as they drive under a bridge
00:02:00:00 Lindberg and Foster signage
00:02:04:00 Sequence of images of women walking, towards and past the camera waving. Good fashion reference.
00:02:11:00 Woman with pram and baby walking down the street
00:02:13:00 Women walking down the street showing great fashion examples
00:02:49:00 Show pony/horse in backyard with show ribbons adorning its back. Impressed onlookers observe the prize winner of the 1949 Coast National Exhibition.
00:03:33:00 A man and a woman walk down a country road, a vintage car drives past in the background
00:03:43:00 Diggers Rest Post Office and General Store
00:03:45:00 People standing in rural setting country Victoria
00:04:36:00 Royal Melbourne Show fire truck display in main arena including Northwood Park fire truck with woodchopping in background
00:05:12:00 Royal Melbourne Show horse riding and woodchopping display
00:05:28:00 Harness racing display at Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:37:00 Horse riding and horse flag and barrel event Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:49:00 Girl on dapple grey horse riding in front of stables at the Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:59:00 Inner Melbourne street scenes, possibly Parkville
00:06:26:00 McInerney’s Hotel Max, Victoria Bitter, Orlando Wines signage on exterior brick wall. Great vintage car and period houses in front of sign.
00:06:29:00 Children in birthday party fashion attire
00:07:04:00 Children in party fashion outfits in suburban backyard with Hills Hoist, mums join in the fun
00:07:28:00 Men and women display great hair fashion of the day as they walk towards camera
00:07:37:00 Children at the birthday party stand under the Hills Hoist and watch a man riding a child’s three-wheel bike
00:07:41:00 Older man leads the birthday party children under the Hills Hoist. Good fashion reference for children.
00:07:55:00 Black and white horse and cart in front of Mynor Fruit Cup advertising. Man in bowler hat and braces runs back and forth and kicks his legs in the air. Great old footage from the time.
00:08:05:00 Women standing in front of sign for the Narbethong Blacks Spur Hotel
00:08:19:00 Man in uniform walks along the street outside pub/hotel
00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.

results.title: [Orsola: Teramo, 1960]
results.brief_description:
In the course of a day, Orsola writes her fiancé, Ulderico Ciabarra, a letter, goes out to post it and reads a magazine in the sunshine. The filmmaker, Francesco Di Silvano, was a family acquaintance and cinema enthusiast who proposed the film as a gift Orsola could send her fiancé, recently settled in Melbourne, Australia. The children that appear in the final sequence are related to the filmmaker.

Note: An excerpt from ‘Orsola: Teramo, 1960’ appears in ‘Innamorati’ (2001/3); a four minute digital storytelling work created by Roberta Ciabarra, ACMI Film Programer and daughter of Orsola and Ulderico, as part of a pilot workshop conducted at ACMI in 2001.For technical reasons a re-record of the narration was done in 2003.

Donor has requested that any de-accessioning of the 8mm film that it be returned to him or the family. File Note with Governance.
results.description:
A ‘day in the life’ of a young woman whose fiancé has emigrated to Melbourne, Australia. In the course of a day, Orsola writes her fiancé, Ulderico, a letter, goes out to post it and reads a magazine in the sunshine.

The filmmaker, Francesco Di Silvano, was a family acquaintance and cinema enthusiast who proposed the film as a gift Orsola could send her fiancé, recently settled in Melbourne, Australia.

The related work “Innamorati” - made by Orsola’s daughter - tells the moving story of Orsola’s marriage and her journey to Australia to be reunited with her husband.

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Peg: a life to remember
results.brief_description: Peg and Bryan have been trekking all over the world since 1987. Bryan recalls their travels and the great times spent with his wife, who now has Alzheimer’s disease. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.
